item.title: Comment on The Screwworm by rayward
item.description:
Hookworms and tapeworms were a big deal down here when I was a child. As for hookworms, they typically infected someone walking barefoot in soil contaminated with the hookworm eggs. Adults would check children's feet for the telltale hook. I don't remember ever being infected by a hookworm, but several of my friends were. My grandmother would have a fit if we went outside without shoes. Tapeworms typically infect someone from eating undercooked meat. The common explanation for a skinny person who ate a lot was that he had a tapeworm. The home remedy for removing a tapeworm can't be mentioned here at this blog. Robert Kennedy Jr. attributes the worm in his brain to eating undercooked pork. Kennedy ate the undercooked pork not the worm. I recall fancy restaurants serving steak tartare (chopped raw beef, seasoned with egg yolk, capers, salt, and spices). It's not exactly raw because it's marinated, but really. Restaurants no longer serve steak tartare, not for fear of liability to customers but the absence of demand for the dish.
